Checking Out Files

When you check out a file, StarTeam copies the requested revision of that file to the appropriate working folder. If a copy of that file is already in the working folder, it is overwritten unless the working file appears to be more recent. In that case, StarTeam asks you to confirm the check out.

To select files across multiple child folders, use the All Descendants button.

To check out all the files in the selected folder and its descendant folders, use Check Out All from the File or context menu. This selection is equivalent to selecting All Descendants, all the files in the upper pane, and Check Out. When you use the Check Out All command, a confirmation dialog appears, regardless of your personal options settings.

To quickly check out the tip revision of one or more files:

  1. Select one or more files from the upper pane.

  2. Do one of the following:

    • Click the Check Out icon on the toolbar.

    • Click the Check Out and Lock icon on the toolbar.

    Either of these actions copies the tip revision to the working folder.

To check out one or more files using the Check Out dialog:

  1. Do one of the following:

    • Select one or more files from the upper pane. Then select Check Out from the File or context menu.

    • Select Check Out All from the File or context menu.

    The Check Out dialog opens.

  2. (Optional) Select Force Check-out to overwrite any files with the same name in your working folder, even if they are more recent.

  3. Under Reference by, select one of the following options for the files you wish to check out:

    • Current Revision, for the most current (or tip) file revision.

    • Label, for a specific file revision. Select the label from the drop-down list box. The existing view and revision labels are listed in reverse chronological order based on the time for which they were created. The view labels precede the revision labels in the list.

    • Promotion State, for a specific promotion state. Select the promotion state from the drop-down list box.

    • As Of, for the revision that was the tip revision at the specified date and time.

      • To use the calendar, click the date/year button.

      • To specify the time, type the time or use the spin boxes.

  4. Select a Lock status option:

    • Unlocked, to simply copy the files to your working folder.

    • Exclusive, to indicate that you intend to make changes to the files and keep others from changing them.

    • Non-exclusive, to indicate that you are working on the files and may possibly make changes.

    • Keep current, to retain the current lock status.

  5. (Optional) Select the Advanced button. This action displays the Advanced Options dialog. Although none of the options on this dialog are required, they are useful in specific situations.

    1. In Checkout Location, click Other if you want to check the files out to a folder other than your designated working folder. Then enter or browse for the folder name.

    2. To change your current EOL conversion setting, click None or another button for an alternate setting. For Windows, the EOL marker is CR-LF (carriage return/line feed); for UNIX, it is LF (line feed); for Macintosh operating systems, it is CR (carriage return). EOL settings on this dialog override the default setting you selected on the File tab of the Personal Options dialog.

    3. (Cross-Platform client only) To support keyword expansion for non-English code pages, make a selection from the File encoding drop-down list box.

    4. Click Close to return to the Check Out dialog.

  6. Click OK to check out the files.

To check out any previous revision of a single file by revision number:

  1. Click the File tab, then select the file name from the File list.

  2. Select the History tab from the lower pane.

  3. On the History tab, highlight the revision to be checked out.

  4. To open the History Checkout dialog, do one of the following:

    • Select Check Out from the History context menu.

    • Select Check Out To from the History context menu and provide a folder name.

    These actions display the Check Out dialog.

  5. On the Check Out dialog, follow steps 3-6, as described above.

Note: Personal options also control how the application behaves on a specific workstation. Some of the options apply to checking files in and out.
